data.text:
2017 Football

Choose a Player:

72 Mitch Mathes

Position Offensive Line

Height 6-2

Weight 272

Class Junior

Letters 1

Hometown LaGrange, Ga.

Highschool Troup County HS

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

Season-by-Season

2017

Appeared in five games as a reserve offensive lineman

Helped the Bears average 332.4 total offensive yards per game

Played a role on an offensive unit that ranked fifth nationally in red zone offense (91.4 percent)

2016

Played in three games before suffering a season-ending injury

2015

Versatile lineman that saw time at several positions along the offensive line during true freshman season

Appeared in eight games for the Bears

Helped the offense average 412.9 yards of total offense per game, including over 200 yards rushing for the third straight year

Paved the way for a rushing attack that cleared 250 yards on the ground in four of his eight contests

Helped a unit that led the FCS in red zone offense (93.2 percent) & ranked third nationally in sacks allowed (8)

Helped offense surpass 400 yards of total offense four times including more than 500 yards on two occasions

Blocked for an offense that set program record with 623 yards of total offense (476 first-half yards) in win over Stetson (Sept. 12)

Part of an offensive line that piled up 286 yards on the ground in win over Furman (Nov. 14)

Before Mercer

High School

Four-year letterwinner for head coach Lynn Kendall at Troup County High School

Helped lead the Tigers to three straight state playoff appearances

Two-time Atlanta Journal Constitution (AJC) AAAA first team all-state honoree

Selected honorable mention all-state by the Georgia Sportswriters Association in 2013 and 2014

Played in the third annual Florida vs. Georgia “Clash of the Scholar-Athletes” all-star game

Awarded Troup County’s offensive lineman of the year honors as a junior and senior

Four-time academic award winner

Personal

Son of Kirt & Melissa Mathes

Has one brother, Ryan

Born March 14, 1997 in Amarillo, Texas
